title: With Comey Indictment, Trump Gets Retribution but Shatters Norms
description: A prosecutor’s drive to indict James Comey trampled over the Justice Department’s long tradition of keeping a distance from politics and the White House, and raised the prospect of more arbitrary charges.

title: At U.N., China Casts Itself as Defender of International Order
description: Li Qiang, China’s second-highest-ranking official, portrayed Beijing as stable leader at a time when President Trump is pulling back from international institutions.

title: Trump Will Slap Tariffs on Imported Drugs, Trucks and Household Furnishings
description: The president said his tariffs would range from 25 to 100 percent and go into effect next week.

title: Wary European Drugmakers Think They Can Avoid Trump’s Latest Tariffs
description: European companies, a major source of U.S. medicines, are hopeful that their investments and trade deals with the U.S. will spare them from President Trump’s latest tariff barrage.

title: Trump’s New Tariffs Shock Countries Reeling From His Chaotic Trade War
description: Throughout Asia, the source of about 40 percent of U.S. imports, countries have little to show for weeks of talks trying to finalize deals.

title: Who Pays for U.S. Tariffs, and Where Does the Money Go?
description: President Trump is seeking to raise federal revenue by imposing levies on goods from foreign nations. Here’s how the process works.

title: In ‘Punch’ on Broadway, Trying to Summon Empathy for the Unforgivable
description: The Broadway play “Punch” retells the true story of a fatal blow and how restorative justice brought healing to the parents and to the young man who threw the punch.

title: NASA Artemis II Astronauts Aim to Make Space Great for All
description: In a preview of their flight, the crew of Artemis II, three Americans and a Canadian, struck a tone that veered away from the political currents of the moment.

title: Filmmaker Joshua Oppenheimer Turns His Camera on History’s Villains
description: Joshua Oppenheimer’s films show the political value of empathy in our polarized age.

title: Marketing Movies Is Harder Than Ever. And Here Comes ‘One Battle After Another.’
description: The film is the kind that isn’t supposed to work in theaters anymore. But Warner Bros., the studio behind it, has successfully bucked trends for months now.

title: New York Film Festival Highlights
description: This year’s highlights include Jim Jarmusch’s “Father Mother Sister Brother,” the Italian documentary “Below the Clouds” and the epic “Magellan.”

title: A Broad Wave of Firings Followed Charlie Kirk’s Assassination
description: More than 145 people in a wide range of occupations have been fired or disciplined after they made statements about the assassination of Charlie Kirk.

title: 5 Dairy Myths That Make Experts Sour
description: We surveyed leading nutrition experts to reveal the truth about raw milk, lactose intolerance, low-fat dairy and more.

title: Mamdani Foes, Struggling to Raise Money, Have Started Buying Attack Ads
description: Several super PACs that oppose Zohran Mamdani’s candidacy for mayor of New York City have banded together to coordinate attack ads.

title: Assata Shakur Dies at 78; Convicted Revolutionary Found Refuge in Cuba
description: A member of a militant Black group, she was found guilty in the 1973 murder of a New Jersey state trooper, escaped from prison and fled to Cuba, where she taught and wrote.

title: Trump Can’t Be the One to Pick Who’s Indicted
description: The Justice Department and the attorney general are supposed to keep a distance from the president, not be his personal score settlers.

title: This Town’s Minerals Make A.I. Possible. Then Came Hurricane Helene.
description: Spruce Pine, N.C., supplies the world’s highest-purity quartz, a mineral that keeps the A.I. revolution afloat. What are the consequences?

title: Political Interference at the Justice Department
description: We examine James Comey’s indictment and an investigation into George Soros’s foundation.

title: ICE Officer ‘Relieved of His Duties’ After Pushing Woman to Floor
description: The Department of Homeland Security said it was investigating an officer’s action during an altercation at a New York City immigration courthouse.

title: Vaccine Skepticism Takes Center Stage in a Close Race for Governor
description: Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican nominee for governor of New Jersey, spoke at an event run by an opponent of vaccine mandates. “We can’t trust him to keep New Jersey kids safe,” Mikie Sherrill, the Democratic candidate, said.

title: Hackers Steal Children’s Data and Photos from U.K. Nursery Chain
description: Kido International, which runs nursery schools, reported the incident to the authorities after hackers posted sensitive data on the dark web and demanded a ransom.
